original_title: Kennedy and Hegseth face off in DoD fitness challenge workout | Fox News
article_summary: Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth competed in a fitness challenge at the Department of Defense, encouraging Americans to prioritize fitness over obesity. The "Pete and Bobby challenge" involved completing 50 pull-ups and 100 push-ups in under five minutes, with Hegseth narrowly beating Kennedy. The competition is part of Kennedy's "Make America Healthy Again" movement, which promotes whole foods and exercise, and Hegseth's push for military fitness. President Trump supports these initiatives.</s>
